metadata.title: USN-6737-2 -- GNU C Library vulnerability
metadata.description: USN-6737-1 fixed a vulnerability in the GNU C Library. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 24.04 LTS.  Original advisory details:   Charles Fol discovered that the GNU C Library iconv feature incorrectly  handled certain input sequences. An attacker could use this issue to cause  the GNU C Library to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly  execute arbitrary code.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6737-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  glibc-doc - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 glibc-source - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 libc-bin - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 libc-dev-bin - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 libc-devtools - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 libc6 - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 libc6-amd64 - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 libc6-dev - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 libc6-dev-amd64 - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 libc6-dev-i386 - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 libc6-dev-s390 - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 libc6-dev-x32 - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 libc6-i386 - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 libc6-s390 - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 libc6-x32 - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 locales - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 locales-all - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 nscd - 2.39-0ubuntu8.1 No subscription required
